meanings.definition: The degree of similarity of the alleles present in an individual
meanings.sent1: The zygosity of the twins was evident in their identical eye color.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the zygosity of the siblings to understand their genetic inheritance.
meanings.sent3: The zygosity of the peas made them look like they were from the same pod!
meanings.sent4: The zygosity between the two teams was so striking that they seemed like mirror images.
meanings.sent5: The zygosity of the fingerprints left no doubt that they came from the same person.

meanings.definition: The state of being homozygous or heterozygous
meanings.sent1: The zygosity of the organism determined its genetic diversity.
meanings.sent2: The zygosity of the population influenced the prevalence of certain traits.
meanings.sent3: The zygosity of the flowers created a colorful mix in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The zygosity of the music in the room created a harmonious atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The zygosity of the ingredients in the dish blended perfectly to create a delicious flavor.
